thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: Last Comic Standing, Lipstick Wars & more
thread.title_full: Last Comic Standing, Lipstick Wars & more

author: courier-journal.com
title: Last Comic Standing, Lipstick Wars & more
text:
Last Comic Standing. Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St., 8 p.m. Friday. $48.50. (502) 584-7777.
Lipstick Wars Poetry Slam. Bomhard Theater, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Saturday. Poetry slam competition for females ages 12 and older. Free.
“Dirty Dancing - The Classic Love Story.” Whitney Hall, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St. 7:30 p.m,. Tuesday and Oct. 14. PNC Broadway presents the classic love story of Baby and Johnny. $32-$104. (502) 584-7777.
Je’Caryous Johnson’s “Things Your Man Won’t Do.” Louisville Palace 625 S. Fourth St., 3 and 7:30 p.m. Sunday. This comedy/drama stars Leon Robinson, Essence Atkins, Allen Payne, Terri Vaughn and Tony Grant. $50. (800) 745-3000.
America’s Got Talent Live: The All-Stars Tour. Whitney Hall, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Sunday. Featuring some of the most popular performers from the show. $30-$65. (502) 584-7777.
And lots more on local stages ...
LIVE MUSIC: Expo Five, The New Vintage & more TAKE THE KIDS: Pumpkin painting, Big Friendly Giant & lots of fall fun HALLOWEEN 2015 : Your guide to local haunts, parties & more AROUND TOWN : Bourbon Splash, Belknap Festival & events in The Ville CONCERTS: Travis Tritt, Vanessa Williams & more this week Children’s Theater
The BFG (Big Friendly Giant). Bomhard Theater, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 2 p.m. Saturday. Stage One presents the story of BFG, a dream catcher who delivers sweet dreams to children. Through Oct. 31. $20 for ages 13 and older; $15 for ages 12 and younger. (502) 584-7777.
Comedy
Last Comic Standing. Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St., 8 p.m. Friday. $48.50. (502) 584-7777.
Bryan Callen. The Laughing Derby at the Comedy Caravan, 1250 Bardstown Road, 7:15 p.m. Thursday; 7:15 and 9:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday. $20. (502) 459-0022.
Damaged Goods: RedRum. The Bards Town, 1801 Bardstown Road, 7:30 p.m. Saturday. $10 cash, at the door.
Poetry
Lipstick Wars Poetry Slam. Bomhard Theater, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Saturday. Poetry slam competition for females ages 12 and older. Free.
Student production
“The Importance of Being Earnest.” Walden Theatre, 1123 Payne St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday and Friday; 2 and 7:30 p.m. Saturday. Walden Theatre/Blue Apple Players presents this comedy about two young men looking to escape social obligations, pretending to be something that they are not. Through Oct. 17. Matinee, $10, $8 for students and seniors; evening, $15, $10 for students and seniors. (502) 589-0084.
Theater
“And Then There Were None.” Derby Dinner Playhouse, 525 Marriott Dr., Clarksville, 7:45 p.m. Thursday-Saturday; 1:30 and 7:45 p.m. Sunday; 1 and 7:45 p.m. Oct. 14. Ten strangers are are trapped on an island together and accusations of murder and cyanide laced cocktails fly as one by one they start to die. Presented by Derby Dinner Playhouse. Through Nov. 8. $37-$46. (812) 288-8281.
“Dirty Dancing - The Classic Love Story.” Whitney Hall, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St. 7:30 p.m,. Tuesday and Oct. 14. PNC Broadway presents the classic love story of Baby and Johnny. $32-$104. (502) 584-7777.
“Disney’s Alice in Wonderland Jr.” Shelby County Community Theatre, 801 Main St., Shelbyville, 7:30 p.m. Thursday-Saturday; 2:30 p.m. Sunday. Youth Production. $15, $12 seniors, $10 students and children. (502) 633-0242.
“Evil Dead: The Musical.” The Alley Theater, 633 W. Main St., 8 p.m. Thursday-Saturday. Cult classic horror comedy. Through Oct. 31. $20 and $30. thealleytheater.org.
“The Fantasticks.” Hayswood Theatre, 115 Capitol Ave., Corydon, 8 p.m. Friday and Saturday; 2 p.m. Sunday. Funny and romantic musical about a boy, a girl, their fathers and a wall. The fathers plot to trick their children into falling in love by pretending to feud. Through Oct. 18. $14, $12 seniors and ages 17 and younger. (812) 738-2138.
Fifth Third Bank’s “Dracula.” Bingham Theatre, Actors Theatre of Louisville, 316 W. Main St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday and Friday; 4 and 8 p.m. Saturday; 2 and 7 p.m. Sunday. Actor Theatre show is based on Bram Stoker’s Gothic tale of the immortal Transylvanian count. Through Nov. 1. $45-$67. (502) 584-1205.
Je’Caryous Johnson’s “Things Your Man Won’t Do.” Louisville Palace 625 S. Fourth St., 3 and 7:30 p.m. Sunday. This comedy/drama stars Leon Robinson, Essence Atkins, Allen Payne, Terri Vaughn and Tony Grant. $50. (800) 745-3000.
“The Two Musketeers.” The Henry Clay, 604 S. Third St., 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday; 4:30 p.m. Sunday. Bunbury Theatre presents this comedy about an acting company eliminating one of the Musketeers from their production of The Three Musketeers due to budget constraints. Through Oct. 25. $22 , $19 seniors, $10 students. (502) 585-5306.
Variety
Golden Dragon Acrobats. Brown Theatre, 315 W. Broadway, 7:30 p.m. Thursday. Part of the Yum! Family Series. The Golden Dragon Acrobats combine acrobatics, traditional dance and ancient and contemporary music. $15-$45. (502) 584-7777.
“Life’s Most Dangerous Game.” Martin Experimental Theater, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Thursday. Blending myth and science, music and visuals, longevity expert Dr. Bill Thomas will tell how to approach aging with the skill and enthusiasm it requires. $26. (502) 584-7777.
Patriot Tour 2015. Brown Theatre, 315 W. Broadway, 7:30 p.m. Saturday. With Marcus Luttrell, Taya Kyle, Joey Jones, David Goggins and Pete Scobell. $53-$93. (502) 584-7777.
America’s Got Talent Live: The All-Stars Tour. Whitney Hall, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Sunday. Featuring some of the most popular performers from the show. $30-$65. (502) 584-7777.
